Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
  Sprite

public class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object

The Sprite class represents a 2D image which can be drawn onto the screen.

Author:
Kevin Scroggins

Constructor Detail

Sprite

public Sprite(java.lang.String fileName,
              java.lang.String spriteDirectory)
Constructs a new Sprite from a specified file and directory.

Parameters:
fileName - the sprite image file name.
spriteDirectory - the directory to read the file from.

Sprite

public Sprite(java.lang.String fileName,
              java.lang.String spriteDirectory,
              int index)
Constructs a Sprite from a specified file and directory and assigns a specified index to it.

Parameters:
fileName - the sprite image file name.
spriteDirectory - the directory to read the file from.
index - the index of the sprite within its parent SpriteSheet.

Sprite

public Sprite(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image,
              int index,
              int x,
              int y,
              int width,
              int height)
Constructs a Sprite from a sub-image of an image and assigns a specific index to it.

Parameters:
image - the image to assign to the Sprite.
index - the index of the Sprite within its parent SpriteSheet.
x - the x offset of the sub-image.
y - the y offset of the sub-image.
width - the width of the sub-image.
height - the height of the sub-image.

Parameters:
